entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:07PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rivers and Streams Rising Through Late Week... Additional rain of up to one inch is expected from the Alaska Range to the Fortymile Uplands through Thursday. Fast rising streams and creeks in the Alaska Range will be most vulnerable, with no flooding anticipated at this time for larger
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 11:21AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RIVER RISES DUE TO MELTING SNOWPACK... UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS HAS RESULTED IN EXCESSIVE SNOWMELT AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS A RESULT, WATER LEVELS IN RIVERS AND STREAMS THAT HAVE THEIR ORIGINS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE BEEN RISING SINCE THIS PAST SUNDAY AND CONTINUE TO RISE TODAY. GREATEST RATES OF RISE ARE
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway
